greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Squares of the differences between consecutive primes.
comment: The sum of reciprocals is likely divergent, especially if the twin-prime conjecture is true.
The sum of the reciprocals diverges. In particular, the sum of the reciprocals up to n is at least n/(log n + log log n)^2 for n > 3. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 17 2012
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
B. Apostol, L. Panaitopol, L Petrescu, L. Toth, Some Properties of a Sequence Defined with the Aid of Prime Numbers, J. Int. Seq. 18 (2015) # 15.5.5.
results.author: _Cino Hilliard_, Nov 19 2002
